text: William Ferdie Brown (December 2, 1940 â€“ October 21, 2019) was an American professional football player, coach, and executive. He played as a cornerback for the Denver Broncos and the Oakland Raiders in the National Football League (NFL). Brown was the head football coach at California State University, Long Beach in 1991, the final season before the school's football program ended. Brown was added into the Pro Football Hall of Fame as a player in 1984. At the time of his death he was on the Raiders' administrative staff. Brown was born in Yazoo City, Mississippi. He studied at Grambling State University. Brown died on October 21, 2019 at his home in Tracy, California at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2019 deaths Category:African- American players of American football Category:American football cornerbacks Category:Denver Broncos players Category:Oakland Raiders players Category:Sportspeople from Mississippi Category:People from Yazoo City, Mississippi
title: Willie Brown (American football)
